IDS250.title: IDS 250 Special Topics: International Travel Course
IDS250.desc: A variable content course with topics involving a foreign travel component. Course offerings represent selected and interdisciplinary subjects. Some courses under this designation may be interdepartmental and team-taught. May be repeated as the topics change.

IDS275.title: IDS 275 Resident Assistant Seminar
IDS275.desc: Designed to facilitate new Resident Assistants in developing the skills necessary to work with students living in the residence halls.

IDS280.title: IDS 280 Student/Life Leadership
IDS280.desc: The course will focus upon the study and practical application of student and student organization leadership skills and the knowledge of campus and community resources. Students will become actively involved in leadership as they participate in individual and group learning experiences.

IDS297.title: IDS 297 International Culture and Study Abroad
IDS297.desc: An interdisciplinary study of other cultures while living and studying in an international venue. Through history, language, literature, sociology and other disciplines the student will acquire a deeper understanding of another culture and of the American culture.

IDS310.title: IDS 310 Peer Leadership
IDS310.desc: Designed for the study and practical application of leadership skills that will benefit Peer Leaders working with GEP 101 instructors and students. Open to Peer Leaders only. May be repeated to a total of 3 hours.

IDS320.title: IDS 320 Job Search Preparation and Career/Life Planning
IDS320.desc: Assists students who have selected an academic major and who are beginning internship, part-time, or full-time job searches, or who are making decisions on graduate and professional school. The course is designed to help students in developing a career plan and investigating the work world in terms of the students' career/life goals. Students will learn the dynamics of decision-making, the importance of gaining experience in their field of interest, and job search skills. They will engage in career research, resume writing, interviewing, networking and other career development practices. Quantity of course content supports need for 2 hour/week format.

IDS350.title: IDS 350 British Life and Culture
IDS350.desc: Through a historical and topical format students will study the interdisciplinary aspects of Great Britain. Lectures will be enhanced through British lecturers and field trips illustrative of the lectures. Missouri-London Program only.
